sentence.Network_en: We apologize for any inconvenience caused during the repairs.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们为维修期间造成的任何不便道歉。

sentence.Network_en: Well, for Heaven's sake, you don't need to apologize.
sentence.Network_cn: 噢,看在上天的份上,你不用道歉.

sentence.Network_en: Beryl came round this morning to apologize.
sentence.Network_cn: 贝丽尔今天上午来登门道歉了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the sense 'make a defensive argument'): from Greek apologizesthai 'give an account', from apologos (see apologue)In English the verb has always been used as if it were a direct derivative of apology

encyclopedia.content: apologize [ə'pɔlədʒaiz] vi. 汉译英 1. 道歉，表示歉意；认错，谢罪： 例句：She apologized for accusing him falsely. 翻译：她为错误地咒骂他而道歉。 2. 锛堃钥谕坊蚴槊嫘问斤級辩护，辩解： 例句：to apologize for oneself. 翻译：为自己辩护。英译英 1. acknowledge faults or shortcomings or failing I apologized for being late He apologized for the many typoes. 2. defend,

entry.def: When you apologize to someone, you say that you are sorry that you have hurt them or caused trouble for them. You can say 'I apologize' as a formal way of saying sorry.

example.ex: Two years ago, Congress formally apologized for the internment...
example.tran: 两年前，国会就此拘留事件正式道歉。

means.word_mean: 1. acknowledge faults or shortcomings or failing;
2. defend, explain, clear away, or make excuses for by reasoning;

sentences.en: I must apologize that if I offended you I didn't mean to.
sentences.cn: 我必须向您道歉, 如果冒犯了您, 我不是有意的。

sentences.en: “Sorry I haven't called you yet, ”Tom apologized.
sentences.cn: “对不起, 我没有给你打电话。”汤姆道歉说道。

jushi.english: If I have made any mistakes,I'm ready to apologize.
jushi.chinese: 如有什么错误,我愿意道歉。
